text: Hi Julians, when it comes to creating spatial maps, which julia package is your recommended package?

elements.text: Hi Julians, when it comes to creating spatial maps, which julia package is your recommended package?

text: Quick and easy - GeoData.jl works with Plots.jl out of the box: ``plot(GDALarray("some.tif"))``. Netcdf works too. If you need to plot specific projections, GeoMakie.jl.

elements.text: Quick and easy - GeoData.jl works with Plots.jl out of the box:
. Netcdf works too. If you need to plot specific projections, GeoMakie.jl.

text: Thanks. Setting GMT on my system have been a real work.

elements.text: Thanks. Setting GMT on my system have been a real work.

text: Yeah it needs a GMT_jll package.

elements.text: Yeah it needs a GMT_jll package.

text: Ok. I will look into that. I was hoping for something mild cos GMT is GMT. A beast to be tame later.

elements.text: Ok. I will look into that. I was hoping for something mild cos GMT is GMT. A beast to be tame later.

text: GeoData.jl/Plots.jl is very mild, but limited to lat/lon heatmaps. Shapefile.jl shapefiles will plot over the top, and that combo is usually enough for me.

elements.text: GeoData.jl/Plots.jl is very mild, but limited to lat/lon heatmaps. Shapefile.jl shapefiles will plot over the top, and that combo is usually enough for me.
